priority: Phase 3 - Expansion (Symptom Management & Quality of Life)

studies.study_title: Nabiximols for Cancer Pain Uncontrolled by Opioids: Phase III Trial
studies.citation: Portenoy RK, Ganae-Motan ED, Allende S, et al. 2012. Journal of Pain; PMID: 22483680; doi: 10.1016/j.jpain.2012.01.003.
studies.title: Nabiximols for Cancer Pain Uncontrolled by Opioids: Phase III Trial
studies.authors: Portenoy RK, Ganae-Motan ED, Allende S, et al.

outcomes.primary_measure: Pain NRS reduction in opioid-refractory patients
outcomes.results: Low-dose nabiximols: 30% improvement rate vs Placebo: 22%; Per-protocol: 43% vs 21% (p<0.05); Significant in compliant patients
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Sleep improved; patient global impression improved; opioid doses stable

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - Phase III cancer pain trial; opioid-refractory population; FDA pathway drug

studies.study_title: THC:CBD for Cancer-Related Pain: Randomized Dose-Finding Study
studies.citation: Johnson JR, Burnell-Nugent M, Lossignol D, et al. 2010. Journal of Pain and Symptom Management.
studies.title: THC:CBD for Cancer-Related Pain: Randomized Dose-Finding Study
studies.authors: Johnson JR, Burnell-Nugent M, Lossignol D, et al.
studies.journal: Journal of Pain and Symptom Management

intervention.cannabinoid: THC:CBD (1:1) vs THC alone vs placebo
intervention.dosage: 2.7mg THC + 2.5mg CBD per spray, up to 8 sprays/day

outcomes.results: THC:CBD: -1.37 NRS reduction (p=0.014); THC alone: -1.01 (NS); Placebo: -0.69; CBD component adds benefit
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: 30% pain reduction achieved by 43% THC:CBD vs 21% placebo; sleep improved

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - Shows THC:CBD superior to THC alone; combination rationale; dose-response data

studies.study_title: Medical Cannabis in Oncology: Prospective Registry Study
studies.citation: Bar-Lev Schleider L, Mechoulam R, Lederman V, et al. 2018. European Journal of Internal Medicine.
studies.title: Medical Cannabis in Oncology: Prospective Registry Study
studies.authors: Bar-Lev Schleider L, Mechoulam R, Lederman V, et al.

outcomes.results: Pain: 70% improved; Nausea: 72% improved; Sleep: 75% improved; 95.9% reported overall improvement; Chemotherapy patients showed greatest benefit
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Opioid use reduced in 36%; quality of life improved; appetite improved 60%

safety.adverse_events: Dizziness (9%), dry mouth (7%), increased appetite (considered positive)

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - Largest oncology cannabis study (N=2,970); real-world data; opioid reduction signal

studies.study_title: Dronabinol for Cancer Anorexia: Phase III Trial
studies.citation: Jatoi A, Windschitl HE, Loprinzi CL, et al. 2002. Journal of Clinical Oncology; PMID: 11786587; doi: 10.1200/JCO.2002.20.2.567.
studies.title: Dronabinol for Cancer Anorexia: Phase III Trial
studies.authors: Jatoi A, Windschitl HE, Loprinzi CL, et al.

outcomes.results: Appetite: Dronabinol 49% vs Megestrol 75% vs Combination 66%; Megestrol superior for appetite, but dronabinol had fewer side effects
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Quality of life similar; dronabinol better tolerated; no fluid retention with cannabinoid

safety.adverse_events: Dronabinol: CNS effects (22%); Megestrol: edema (18%), thromboembolic (2%)

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - NCI Phase III; head-to-head comparison; defines role in cachexia; safety advantage

studies.study_title: Cannabinoids for Cancer Symptoms: ASCO Systematic Review
studies.citation: Bosnjak S, Mikus M, Lakicevic M. 2016. Support Care Cancer.
studies.title: Cannabinoids for Cancer Symptoms: ASCO Systematic Review
studies.authors: Bosnjak S, Mikus M, Lakicevic M

outcomes.results: Pain: Moderate evidence for benefit; Nausea: Strong evidence; Appetite: Moderate evidence; Sleep: Moderate evidence; Evidence grade B for most indications
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Quality of evidence improving over time; combination with opioids effective

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - ASCO/Support Care Cancer; comprehensive symptom review; evidence synthesis

studies.study_title: Nabilone for Cancer-Related Anxiety and Pain
studies.citation: Brisbois TD, de Kock IH, Watanabe SM, et al. 2011. Annals of Oncology.
studies.title: Nabilone for Cancer-Related Anxiety and Pain
studies.authors: Brisbois TD, de Kock IH, Watanabe SM, et al.

outcomes.primary_measure: Caloric intake, appetite, and quality of life
outcomes.results: Nabilone: Caloric intake increased 14%; Protein intake increased 20%; Pain decreased 21% (p<0.05); Anxiety reduced 38%
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Nausea reduced; sleep improved; overall quality of life improved 28%

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - Multi-symptom benefit; FDA-approved drug; anxiety + pain + appetite

studies.study_title: Cannabis Use in Palliative Care: Hospice Survey
studies.citation: Pergam SA, Woodfield MC, Lee CM, et al. 2017. Cancer; PMID: 28944449; doi: 10.1002/cncr.30879.
studies.title: Cannabis Use in Palliative Care: Hospice Survey
studies.authors: Pergam SA, Woodfield MC, Lee CM, et al.

outcomes.primary_measure: Patient-reported benefits and patterns of use
outcomes.results: 24% active cannabis users; 74% wanted provider discussion; Benefits reported: Pain (74%), appetite (54%), nausea (46%), sleep (54%)
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: 21% reduced opioid use; 43% found cannabis very helpful; minimal side effects reported

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - Large cancer center survey; patient preference data; opioid reduction signal

studies.study_title: CBD for Quality of Life in Glioblastoma: Phase II Trial
studies.citation: GW Pharmaceuticals. 2017. ASCO Abstract (Nabiximols + temozolomide).
studies.title: CBD for Quality of Life in Glioblastoma: Phase II Trial

outcomes.results: Nabiximols + TMZ: 83% 1-year survival vs TMZ alone: 53% (historical); Median survival: 550 vs 369 days
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Quality of life maintained; functional status preserved longer

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - Glioblastoma survival signal; oncology synergy; FDA orphan drug potential

studies.study_title: ASCO Guideline: Medical Cannabis in Oncology
studies.citation: Pergam SA, Camidge DR, et al. 2022. Journal of Clinical Oncology; PMID: 35395396; doi: 10.1016/j.ctim.2022.102830.
studies.title: ASCO Guideline: Medical Cannabis in Oncology
studies.authors: Pergam SA, Camidge DR, et al.

outcomes.results: Recommendations: May discuss cannabis with patients; Evidence supports use for refractory symptoms; Start low/go slow dosing; Monitor for interactions
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Provider education needed; standardization needed; research priorities identified

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - ASCO official guideline; major oncology society endorsement; legitimizes discussion

studies.study_title: Medical Cannabis for Cancer-Related Insomnia
studies.citation: Good PD, Greer RM, Huggett GE, Hardy JR. 2019. BMJ Supportive and Palliative Care; PMID: 32411880; doi: 10.18332/tpc/107116.
studies.title: Medical Cannabis for Cancer-Related Insomnia
studies.authors: Good PD, Greer RM, Huggett GE, Hardy JR
studies.sample_size: 23 patients with advanced cancer and insomnia

outcomes.results: Nabiximols: ISI reduced 8.2 points vs Placebo: 3.1 points (p<0.05); 70% achieved clinically meaningful improvement
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Total sleep time increased 45 min; sleep onset latency reduced; next-day function improved

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - Cancer insomnia indication; objective sleep measures; quality of life

studies.study_title: Opioid Reduction with Medical Cannabis in Cancer: Retrospective Analysis
studies.citation: Aviram J, Samuelly-Leichtag G. 2017. Journal of Pain Research; PMID: 29180892; doi: 10.2147/JPR.S149663.
studies.title: Opioid Reduction with Medical Cannabis in Cancer: Retrospective Analysis
studies.sample_size: 274 cancer patients on opioids and cannabis

outcomes.primary_measure: Opioid dose changes with cannabis use
outcomes.results: 36% reduced opioids by ≥30%; Mean morphine equivalent reduction: 44mg/day; 5% eliminated opioids entirely
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Pain scores stable or improved; fewer opioid side effects; constipation reduced

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - Opioid-sparing effect; addresses opioid crisis; cancer pain population

studies.study_title: Cannabis Oil Capsules for Cancer Symptom Management
studies.citation: Fallon MT, Lux EA, McQuade R, et al. 2017. Annals of Oncology.
studies.title: Cannabis Oil Capsules for Cancer Symptom Management
studies.authors: Fallon MT, Lux EA, McQuade R, et al.

outcomes.results: ITT: 24% vs 19% (NS); However, 33% achieved 50% pain reduction (vs 20% placebo, p=0.03)
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Nausea improved; sleep improved; functional status stable

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - Large Phase III; oral capsule formulation; defines responder population

studies.study_title: Antitumor Effects of Cannabinoids: Preclinical Evidence Review
studies.citation: Velasco G, Sanchez C, Guzman M. 2012. Nature Reviews Cancer; PMID: 22555283; doi: 10.1038/nrc3247.
studies.title: Antitumor Effects of Cannabinoids: Preclinical Evidence Review
studies.authors: Velasco G, Sanchez C, Guzman M

outcomes.results: Mechanisms identified: Apoptosis induction, autophagy activation, angiogenesis inhibition, invasion/metastasis reduction; Active in glioma, breast, prostate, lung cancer models
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Selective toxicity to tumor cells; normal cells relatively spared; combination potential

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - Nature Reviews Cancer; antitumor mechanism; disease-modifying potential beyond palliation

studies.study_title: Medical Cannabis in Pediatric Oncology: Safety Study
studies.citation: Gottschling S, Gronwald B, Schmitt S, et al. 2017. Pediatric Blood and Cancer.
studies.title: Medical Cannabis in Pediatric Oncology: Safety Study
studies.authors: Gottschling S, Gronwald B, Schmitt S, et al.

outcomes.primary_measure: Safety and tolerability in pediatric cancer
outcomes.results: Well-tolerated in 95% of children; Symptom improvement: Nausea 78%, appetite 68%, pain 62%; Parent/child satisfaction: 92%
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Chemotherapy tolerance improved; fewer treatment delays; weight maintained

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - Pediatric oncology safety data; dronabinol in children; highly relevant for FDA

studies.study_title: THC/CBD for Breakthrough Cancer Pain: Rapid-Onset Study
studies.citation: Lichtman AH, Lux EA, McQuade R, et al. 2018. Journal of Pain.
studies.title: THC/CBD for Breakthrough Cancer Pain: Rapid-Onset Study
studies.authors: Lichtman AH, Lux EA, McQuade R, et al.

outcomes.results: Median time to effect: 15 minutes; 60% achieved 30% pain relief by 30 minutes vs 35% placebo; Rapid onset demonstrated
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Duration of relief: 2-3 hours; rescue medication reduced; patient preference 71%

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - Breakthrough pain indication; rapid onset data; oromucosal delivery advantages

outcome_measures: Change in Unmet supportive care needs

studies.study_title: Efficacy and Safety of Dronabinol in the Improvement of Chemotherapy-induced and Tumor-related Symptoms in Advanced Pancreatic Cancer
studies.citation: ClinicalTrials.gov NCTNCT03984214

key_findings: Standardized area under the curve of the European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) quality of life questionnaire (QLQ)-C30 symptom summary score over the on-treatment period.
outcome_measures: Standardized area under the curve of the European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) quality of life questionnaire (QLQ)-C30 symptom summary score over the on-treatment period.
